item.title: [MEGASOFT] Sigma Advanced Systems Wins Rs. 100 Crore Order From Ministry of Defence
item.description:
Sigma Advanced Systems has secured fresh orders worth about Rs. 100 crore from the Ministry of Defence and associated defence PSUs. The contracts relate to ongoing strategic programmes across missile systems, naval platforms, and airborne applications, under which Sigma will supply built-to-spec systems, control electronics, and actuation solutions. The scope of work covers Surface-to-Air Missile (SAM) programmes, Anti-tank missile programmes, New Generation Anti-radiation missile programmes, and naval weapon systems.

  • Sigma Advanced Systems has secured orders worth about Rs. 100 crore from the Ministry of Defence and associated defence PSUs.
  • The contracts relate to ongoing strategic programmes across missile systems, naval platforms, and airborne applications.
  • Sigma will supply built-to-spec systems, control electronics, and actuation solutions.
  • The scope of work covers Surface-to-Air Missile (SAM) programmes, Anti-tank missile programmes, New Generation Anti-radiation missile programmes, and naval weapon systems.
  • Sigma will execute these orders for leading defence public sector undertakings and research laboratories, including Bharat Dynamics Limited (BDL), Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL), and the Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) establishments.

item.title: [HEXT] Hexaware Technologies Ltd: Appointment of Alok Chandra Misra as Non-Executive Independent Director, Resignation of Vivek Sharma, and Reconstitution of Committees
item.description:
Hexaware Technologies Ltd has announced the appointment of Alok Chandra Misra as an Additional Director in the capacity of Non-Executive Independent Director for a term of 3 years, starting from February 23, 2026. Mr. Misra is a seasoned professional with extensive experience in financial roles and as a public company CFO. He co-founded Guvrn, India's first curated board network, and has served as Operating Partner and Chief Operating Officer of India at General Atlantic. Furthermore, Mr. Vivek Sharma has resigned from his position as an Independent Director due to other professional commitments. The Board has also approved the reconstitution of committees, with Mr. Misra joining as a member of the Audit Committee, Nomination & Remuneration Committee, Risk Management Committee, Environmental, Social & Governance Committee, and Cybersecurity Committee.

  • Appointment of Alok Chandra Misra as Non-Executive Independent Director
  • Resignation of Vivek Sharma from the position of Independent Director
  • Reconstitution of Committees of the Board
  • Alok Chandra Misra's extensive experience in financial roles and as a public company CFO
  • Vivek Sharma's resignation due to other professional commitments

item.title: [ADITYA] Aditya Ispat Ltd Approves Slump Sale of Non-alloy Steel Business for INR 3,67,63,000
item.description:
ðŸ”¥ Trending

Aditya Ispat Ltd announced the outcome of its board meeting held on February 23, 2026. The board approved the slump sale of the business of manufacturing and trading activity of Non-alloy steel of the company on a going concern basis at a lump sum consideration of INR 3,67,63,000. The sale will be effective from 01.03.2026, subject to the approval of the Members of the Company through postal ballot. The board also approved the appointment of M/s Ernst & Young LLP as consultants for assistance in implementation of the BTA and appointed Mr. Manjeet Bucha as the Scrutinizer for the purposes of collating the Postal Ballot and remote e-voting data.

item.description:

item.title: [IDFCFIRSTB] IDFC First Bank Ltd Clarifies Price Movement Not Due to De-Empanelment but Fraud Identification
item.description:
ðŸ”¥ Trending

IDFC First Bank Ltd has clarified that the recent price movement in its securities is not due to de-empanelment but rather the identification and disclosure of a fraud. The bank followed due process, informing the Special Committee of the Board, Audit Committee, Board, police authorities, and relevant regulatory bodies. A forensic audit was also initiated with KPMG.
